Member Function Documentation

void GfxFeatureMap::addFeature (  GfxFeature *  feature  ) 
 

Add a feature to the map, is added after existing features in the map.

The map takes over the ownership of the feature and deletes it with the map or when it is remove with removeFeature.

Parameters:
feature The GfxFeature to add.

GfxFeature* GfxFeatureMap::getAndRemoveFirstFeature (   )  [private]
 

Get the first Feature in this map and remove it!

Returns:
The first GfxFeature in this map, will be removed from this map. NULL will be returned if no features left.

Definition at line 488 of file GfxFeatureMap.h.

byte* GfxFeatureMap::getAsSimpleMapData (  int  version,
uint32 &  outSize
)  const
 

Get the gfxmap as "simple map data", i.e.

a very simple map format suitable for primitive clients.

Parameters:
version The version of simple map data to be used. Currently only version 1 exists.
outSize [OUT] Will be set to the number of bytes of the resulting buffer.
Returns:
A new byte array containing the map. Must be deleted by the caller. Contains outSize number of bytes. If invalid version is supplied then the buffer returned is NULL.

GfxFeature::gfxFeatureType  type
)  const
 

Get unique features of a certain type.

bool GfxFeatureMap::load (  DataBuffer *  data  ) 
 

Load GfxFeatureMap data from the DataBuffer data.

If reading fails no data is inserted into the map.

Parameters:
data DataBuffer with the GfxFeatureMap data to read.
Returns:
True if all data was read and inserted into map, false if error reading GfxFeatureMap data.

uint32 GfxFeatureMap::loadHeader (  DataBuffer *  data  ) 
 

Load GfxFeatureMap header from the DataBuffer data.

If reading fails no data is inserted into the map. This method is used when merging maps into a packet without creation feature objects.

Parameters:
data DataBuffer with the GfxFeatureMap data to read.
Returns:
Number of features after header, MAX_UINT32 if error.

int GfxFeatureMap::mergeInto (  GfxFeatureMap *  otherMap,
bool  keepOrder = true
) 
 

Merge data from another map into this one.

No data will be copied, so the map given as parameter will be empty after this call.

Parameters:
otherMap The map to get the data from, will be empty when this method returns.
keepOrder If order should be preseved, default true.
Returns:
The number of features from otherMap that is moved into this map. A negative value will be returned upon error.

void GfxFeatureMap::mergeRouteSettings (  const GfxFeatureMap *  otherMap  ) 
 

Sets the route settings in this GfxFeature map to those of another map.

bool GfxFeatureMap::removeFeature (  uint32  index  ) 
 

Remove and delete feature at index index.

Parameters:
index The index of the feature to remove.
Returns:
True if feature was removed or false if index was out of range.

void GfxFeatureMap::reverseFeatures (   ) 
 

Reverse the order of the features.

bool GfxFeatureMap::save (  DataBuffer *  data,
DataBuffer *  featureData,
uint32  nbrFeatures
)  const
 

Save GfxFeatureMap data into the DataBuffer data using the featureData buffer as feature data.

This method is used when merging maps into a packet without creation feature objects.

Parameters:
data DataBuffer to insert GfxFeatureMap data into, must be at least getMapSize + featureData->getCurrentOffset bytes long.
Returns:
True if all map data was inserted into the DataBuffer, false if error.

bool GfxFeatureMap::save (  DataBuffer *  data  )  const
 

Save GfxFeatureMap data into the DataBuffer data.

If saving fails no partial data should be left in the DataBuffer.

Parameters:
data DataBuffer to insert GfxFeatureMap data into, must be at least getMapSize bytes long.
Returns:
True if all map data was inserted into the DataBuffer, false if error while saving GfxFeatureMap data.

bool GfxFeatureMap::saveHeader (  DataBuffer *  data,
uint32  nbrFeatures
)  const
 

Writes the header data into data.

This method is used when merging maps into a packet without creation feature objects.

Parameters:
data DataBuffer to insert GfxFeatureMap header into.
nbrFeatures The number of features to write in header.
Returns:
True.

uint32 GfxFeatureMap::m_scaleLevel [private]
 

The scale of this map.

Could be calculated from m_bbox and m_screenBBox, but stored to be more flexible. The scale-value represents the number of meters / pixel.
